page.title: 18THE POWER STATION
page.content: When the power station burns coal, oil or gas, it produces hot steam. The hot steam turns the steam turbine, which turns the generator, which produces electricity. Meanwhile the steam gets cooled by water from the river nearby. The water drips down on the rising steam and then the water, which cooled the steam, is returned to the river. The electricity is sent everywhere on cables carried by pylons and sometimes underground. Electricity is sent to houses, shops, offices and factories. It is very important. It makes televisions, videos, radios, computers and many more things work. Electricity is very important. Life would be very different without it.
